availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew B. McCrea (Eddyville, Blacksmith and farrier 15th Ky. Cav.)

body.p: Lyon County, Kentucky, blacksmith and soldier. Native of Scotland. Married to Elizabeth Dix McCrea in Lyon County, Kentucky, on April 22, 1856. Father of William McCrea, Andrew McCrea, and James A. McCrea. Master blacksmith in Eddyville in 1860. Served in the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a farrier and blacksmith from March 11, 1863, to October 6, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lyon County, Eddyville, p. 764.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Fredonia, p. 490A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Lyon County Marriages, Film #000321364, p. 139 of 303 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 402.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0135.
